dmca.title: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3556982Z] www.clicks18.info is stealing content from my blog and
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

 

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

 

________________________________

From: jacob.share@shareselectmedia.com
[mailto:jacob.share@shareselectmedia.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, March 21, 2007 5:30 PM
To: Copyright
Subject: Re: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3556982Z] www.clicks18.info is
stealing content from my blog and others

 

Yes, I understand. I surfed to copyright.gov but I haven't found the
correct form and that's why I haven't sent it yet. Can you please
specify a direct url for the DMCA complaint form needed in this case?

Today I confirmed that your client is stealing more of my content on
www.clicks13.info too.

Thank you in advance,

Jacob Share


On Wed Mar 21 13:40 , 'Copyright' sent:

<javascript:top.opencompose('jacob.share@shareselectmedia.com','','','')
>  
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 20 Mar 2007 15:06:54.0801 (UTC)
FILETIME=[65A83410:01C76B01] 

MIME element (text/html) 
Hello,

To my dismay, I discovered this morning that a site on your servers has
begun stealing some of my blog's content and others. In my case, the
site has taken my RSS feed and simply copied an entire post and pasted
it to http://www.clicks18.info/Courses.htm (search for the word
'distractions'). They removed my copyright notice but left most of the
other links intact, you can compare with my feed here:
http://jobmob.co.il/feed/.
> 


Doing a reverse IP lookup after a whois lookup of clicks18.info, it
appears that you are hosting the site, which means that clicks18.info is
violating your Acceptable Usage Policy in addition to the DMCA. 



Please take appropriate action. If you think it useful, I will also
submit a DMCA complaint



Sincerely,



----

Jacob Share

CEO, Share Select Media
